intro: Pilosella × bifurca subsp. vindobonensis, commonly known as the Vindobonensis hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The subspecies is distinguished by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and its ability to thrive in dry, sunny habitats. It is often found in meadows and along roadsides, where it contributes to local biodiversity. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and horticultural interest.
